title: Newcastle United boss Rafa Benitez demands FA investigation after Wolves fans ‘abuse’ midfielder Jonjo Shelvey
text:
3 Rafa Benitez has called for more protection for Jonjo Shelvey after the midfielder was subject to a torrent of ‘abuse’ by Wolves fans in their clash 
Molineux fans responded on Saturday with chants of “dirty racist b d” and “you’re a w ” towards Shelvey. 
Keep up to date with ALL the NEWCASTLE UNITED news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But he kept a cool head and had the last laugh by helping to create the winning goal for Aleksandar Mitrovic — his first in four months. PA:Press Association 3 Aleksandar Mitrovic was assisted for the eventual winner by Jonjo Shelvey 
But Benitez hopes the FA probe fans’ behaviour and feels they should have shown more respect towards Shelvey. 
He said: “It was not an easy game for him but he did well. 
“He showed composure and a cool mind to play and keep the ball. He did a good job. 
“Was the abuse difficult for him? He is a professional. He knows you have to concentrate on the game. 
“He did expect it. But the FA has to maybe consider what the fans were saying. 
“Maybe the FA should look at that, to control what fans say and have more respect.” Related Stories Striker: Nick's ears are burning from the Hong Kong Heat... Toon skipper Jamaal Lascelles felt Shelvey’s performance was the perfect response. 
He said: “Jonjo handled it really well. After last time, it was terrible what happened to him. It should never have happened. 
“Jonjo is not that type of person. A few of us told him to keep his head because they might try to wind him up again. 
“I just said ‘play your football, you can embarrass them by being the best player on the pitch’. That is what he did. 
“Credit to him, he’s a smart lad. He kept a cool head.” Real Madrid legend Roberto Carlos tries to put off football freestyler as he performs tricks PA:Press Association 3 Toon midfielder Jonjo Shelvey is often seen as the pantomime villain by rival fans, but has found himself in big trouble this season 
An ill-tempered game saw Benitez haul Mitrovic off at half-time to avoid the risk of being sent off. 
He had already been booked and was fortunate to escape a second yellow for a challenge on Wolves keeper Carl Ikeme. 
Benitez said: “It was a risk to leave him on. We needed to be sure.” 
Wolves boss Paul Lambert is convinced his side are making positive strides despite back-to-back defeats seeing them sink back to 18th. 
He said: “The way we are playing is as important to me as results. 
“Everyone who comes to watch us at this minute knows we are an exciting team and a different team to what I inherited. 
“We’ve been beaten two on the spin but you bounce back.”
